title: Space Force tries to hedge risk with new launch strategy
summary: As it prepares to award the next round of National Security Space Launch contracts, the Space Force is no longer comfortable relying on just two companies.

title: Scout Space, Stanford University win Space Force contract extension
summary: Scout won a $1.5 million contract to help the U.S. Space to characterize spacecraft and debris objects.

title: Chinese startup launches 7th Ceres-1 rocket, preps for first sea launch
summary: Galactic Energy achieved its seventh launch success from seven attempts early Thursday and is now set for a first sea-based mission.

title: It’s finally time—Virgin Galactic is flying private astronauts into space
summary: It must be a magical moment to float freely above the world.

title: Viasat not ready to declare Viasat-3 Americas a total loss
summary: Viasat is holding off on a contingency plan for ViaSat-3 Americas in the hope it could still get some capacity from the broadband satellite despite its defective antenna, the operator’s chair and CEO Mark Dankberg said Aug. 9.
